availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Procter (Simpson County, KY, farmer and pvt 26th Ky Vol Inf)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Hezekiah Procter and Catherine Procter. Married to Nancy E. Procter. Father of Ella Procter, Annie Procter, and Ida Procter. Student in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Simpson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Simpson County in 1860. Served in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from December 11, 1861, to April 30, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 50B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 43.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 302B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. 4B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 214-5.
